thread.title: New Bedford voters casting at-large, Ward 4 ballots
thread.title_full: New Bedford voters casting at-large, Ward 4 ballots

author: Mike Lawrence mlawrence@s-t.com
title: New Bedford voters casting at-large, Ward 4 ballots
text: Posted Oct. 6, 2015 at 1:42 PM By Mike Lawrence Posted Oct. 6, 2015 at 1:42 PM » Social News NEW BEDFORD — With Hurricane Joaquin far out to sea, city elections staff have one less worry today as New Bedford voters take to the polls in the preliminary election for City Council at-large and Ward 4 races. The threat of a postponed vote loomed late last week, when Joaquin’s path up the East Coast remained uncertain. But skies couldn’t be more clear above New Bedford today, with beautiful fall weather that could boost voter turnout for two races where margins could be slim. Polls for the preliminary at-large and Ward 4 City Council election will be open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. Tuesday, at 36 voting locations across the city. Voters in all 36 precincts will be able to vote for up to FIVE of the 11 at-large candidates, who appear on the ballot in the following order: Naomi R.A. Carney (incumbent)
